examples: everything moves relatively to one another, perhaps you're just not moving fast enough!
Take off his hat when raining because it's easier to wash his hair than dry his hat
Never remembered his address because he would rather store other information in his brain
Tried to make a hole in his sister's head
Made fun of American journalist asking him in bad German when he came to the US

personal_history.description: Reads The Elements by Euclid, a book on geometry, and falls in love with math

personal_history.event_name: Fails To Get Into ETH Zurich
personal_history.description: Scores well on math and physics but scores low on language
Falls in love with a daughter of a professor whose home he was staying at. Breaks up a year later as they choose different life paths

personal_history.event_name: Gets fired from his first job
personal_history.description: Conflict with his superior because of his part-time job as a tutor, eventually gets fired
Writes 5 papers for 3 of which he eventually is recognized for Nobel Prize later in his life for creating a new branch of physics
